Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2010 12:44PM rockermom wrote: Hi Melinda, hope you are doing well after your surgery.  i am habing a bilat mx on 2-22-10 and i really enjoyed your letter.  it expressed some fellings and thoughts that i have been afraid to face but i feel better after reading it.  thank you for putting it in words.  good luck to you LauraM looks like we're mx twins!!!  hugs and prayers to you. hugs to all rockermom
Posts.Title: A letter to my boob Melinda41 JanetinVirginia

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2010 09:26PM rockermom wrote: Thanks Groundhog,  yes, he said he would do what ever i wanted but did not seem happy that i wanted both removed.  i was starting to wonder if i wa being unreasonable in wanting both gone.  there is a spot on left that they want to watch which means that every 6 months i have to go back for more mamo's and ultrasounds and maybe biopsey so why not have it removed now instead of going thru that all over again (at least that's how i see it.)  what would you do?  hugs back to you all. rockermom
Posts.Title: I JUST WANT THEM OFF JudeMama Delilahbear

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2010 09:33PM rockermom wrote: Hi Jude, good luck with your insurance company-- in 2007 mine would not approve MRI because i did not have family history of Breast Cancer even though i had about 1/3 of my right breast removed in 2006 for it, i guess i'm not family.  so instead, i had to have another surgical biopsey which they did pay for.  i have not checked to see where i stand on removal yet so i may be fighting same battle.  we have to all hang tuff and fight.  prayers and hugs to you.
Posts.Title: I JUST WANT THEM OFF JudeMama Delilahbear

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2010 11:42PM rockermom wrote: thanks Groundhog--i know it is my decision and i think i have made it. have you ever regreted the decision you made?   part of me thinks i'm being silly to want both off just because i'm afraid that it may reoccure in left side. thanks
Posts.Title: I JUST WANT THEM OFF JudeMama Delilahbear

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2010 11:02PM rockermom wrote: I know how you feel, for several years i went for mamo and ultrasound every 6 months in april 2006 my nightmare really started-- first had needle biopsy which was very painful only to be told that they could not get all they needed then i had surgical biopsy and was told that i had dcis so i had a partial mastectomy (right side) since then, i have had two more biopsies on same side and two on left now, they want to do another one but, i want both gone i can't keep going thru this every 6-8 months.  it is getting the best of me emotionally,physically and financialy.  my surgeon told me today to think about it for a week and let him know what i want but he is only recommending the right one removed.  i need advice from someone as to what to do. thanks, rockermom
Posts.Title: I JUST WANT THEM OFF JudeMama Delilahbear

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2010 12:46PM rockermom wrote: thanks to you all this has helped me a lot.  since my first dx my sisters have been saying how strong i am because i have never let myself admit that i had the ugly "c" dx.  i would not even park in the cancer center lot during myradiation because it meant admitting it. (silly i know) but now, it is starting to get to me and i have to stay strong ( i have a 23 year old son that can make me into a limp dishrag with his big hugs and tears of fear so i told him that it is not that big a deal.  all of your advice about insurance and everything else has really helped stuff i never thought about. thank you for the hugs and support ande i am sending them back to you.   i'm sorry about all of you going thru this but it is nice to have someone to talk to about it. well gotta go to grocery store so i'll go for now love ande hugs to all. rockermom
Posts.Title: I JUST WANT THEM OFF JudeMama Delilahbear
